pullRequest.body:
This is just a modified version of the code provided by Antoine Chambert-Loir here: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/jordan-chevalley.20decomposition/near/411402670

Co-authored-by: Antoine Chambert-Loir <antoine.chambert-loir@math.univ-paris-diderot.fr>

---


[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7803098360/job/21282064667)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7803098360/job/21282064077)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7803098360/job/21282063408)
I think something like `newtonMap_apply_of_IsUnit` (or a similar name) is a reasonable addition, maybe even the case when `P'(x)` is not a unit.

Can you use here `induction` rather than `induction'`? Not very important, but sooner or later `induction'` will disappear.

Similarly elsewhere.
OK I still prefer `induction'` but perhaps I need to get over this. Done!

```suggestion
unit) then we may write `x` as a sum `x = n + r` where `n` is nilpotent and `r` is a root of `P`. Moreover, `n` and `r` are unique.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: define Newton's method and prove decomposition as nilpotent + root

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add proof of Jordan-Chevalley-Dunford decomposition
